text.section:
An action may be maintained in the name of this State or the Board to enjoin:
The unauthorized practice of chiropractic or massage therapy; or
Conduct that is a ground for disciplinary action under § 3-313 of this subtitle or § 3-5A-11 of this title.

An action under this section may be brought by:
The Board, in its own name;
The Attorney General, in the name of this State; or
A State's Attorney, in the name of this State.

An action under this section shall be brought in the county where the defendant:
Resides; or
Engages in the acts sought to be enjoined.

section.section: Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, an action under this section may not be brought against an individual who is authorized to practice a health occupation under this article.
An action under this section may be brought against an individual who is authorized to practice chiropractic or massage therapy under this title.

text.section: Proof of actual damage or that any person will sustain any damage if an injunction is not granted is not required for an action under this section.

An action under this section is in addition to and not instead of criminal prosecution for:
The unauthorized practice of chiropractic under § 3-501 of this title or disciplinary action under § 3-313 of this subtitle; or
The unauthorized practice of massage therapy under § 3-501 of this title or disciplinary action under § 3-5A-11 of this title.
